intro: Gonolobus spiranthus, commonly known as the spiralflower, is a flowering plant belonging to the Leguminosae family. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas, particularly in areas with warm, humid climates. The plant is characterized by its unique spiral arrangement of flowers along the stem, which gives it its common name. Its leaves are typically trifoliate, with three leaflets that are oval to lance-shaped. Gonolobus spiranthus is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats, including forests and open fields.
